Description: Big fragment of an ostracon made from a pottery vessel which is a small wheel made bowl with red rim, about 25cm in diameter, small fragment broken off at the base, showing a fresh break. At the inner surface 8 lines of hieratic writing in black ink, most of them barely visible. At the outer side a 11cm large patch of a whitish substance and at least 5 lines of hieratic text, very faint, not visible in lower part of the sherd.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E14.6 (lower level, just outside E14.14)
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 65)
